raw_text:
Barbara H. Agricola* Algert S. Agricola, Jr.
barbara@agricolalaw.com al@agricolalaw.com
*Also admitted in Georgia
September 4, 2025
Via Electronic Mail
Dianne Davis
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
RE: McGregor v. Gilliland
Case No: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Our File No.: 300.036
Dear Dianne:
I have reviewed your client’s discovery responses submitted July 30, 2024. After reviewing
the discovery responses, there are still several responses that were either deficient, nonresponsive,
and/or incomplete. I have attached our client’s initial discovery requests for your convenience. The
following discovery responses are deficient and/or incomplete for the following reasons:
Interrogatories:
1. Describe in detail each instance since February 27, 2024, in which you did not allow the Petitioner-
Mother, Brittany Michelle Gilliland, her scheduled visitation rights with the minor children A.K.
and B.M.
Response: I have never refused Brittany her scheduled visitation rights with either
minor child.
This response was submitted July 30, 2024. There is sufficient reason to believe that this response
is not up to date. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory
with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature.
2. List all communications you have had with the children's school or educational institution
concerning Brittany Gilliland and provide the content of such communications.
Response: See attached email exchanges from Blaine to staff at L. Morgan and ME
Walker.
This response was submitted July 30, 2024. There is sufficient reason to believe that this response
is not up to date. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory
with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature. Please
supplement this interrogatory with any further communications you have held since the original
date of your response, including any and all schools the children have attended.
127 South 8th Street Opelika, Alabama 36801 Phone: 334.759.7557 Facsimile: 334.759.7558
www.agricolalaw.com
3. Please detail any reasons and the factual basis for why you prevented Brittany Gilliland from
picking up A.K. from school as stipulated in the Final Decree of Divorce.
Response: I have never prevented Brittany from picking up A.K. from school.
This response was submitted July 30, 2024. There is sufficient reason to believe that this response
is not up to date. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory
with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature.
7. Please state all facts that support your accusations made against Brittany Gilliland of causing
physical harm to A.K. or any of the minor children.
Response: Objection. Irrelevant as to issues in Petition.
Your client must state all facts that support his accusations made against Brittany Gilliland of
causing physical harm to A.K. or any of the minor children. This response is not acceptable as it
is presented and is therefore, deficient. Please supplement this interrogatory.
8. If you have conducted any surveillance, including but not limited to electronic surveillance
(electronic surveillance being defined as the interception of any voice communication made by the
Petitioner by electronically recording the same or by listening in on any voice communication
made by the Petitioner), of the Petitioner, or had any person or persons conduct such surveillance
on your behalf, then state what surveillance you have conducted, including the date, time and place
of such surveillance, the method employed for such surveillance, the person conducting such
surveillance, including the name and address of such person, whether said surveillance was
recorded, whether a written transcript or report have been made of such surveillance, and the
details of what was observed and/or the details of the conversations that were intercepted or
recorded, regardless of whether you intend to use such documentation at trial. This includes
anything related to rebuttal or impeachment.
Response: I do not have surveillance.
This response was submitted July 30, 2024. There is sufficient reason to believe that this response
is not up to date. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory
with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature.
10. Please provide a detailed list of the personal property items you have failed to distribute to
Brittany Gilliland per the Final Decree of Divorce, including but not limited to wall décor,
bedroom lamps, memory boxes, and clothing.
Response: Brittany was given all property items set out in the Final Order, plus more.
Her friend, Jeannie Hamlet, came to the house and removed everything
that Brittany was entitled to have plus items that were not granted to her.
Your client must list each and every item of personal property in detail that has or has not been
given to our client. This response is not acceptable as it is presented and is therefore, deficient.
Please supplement this interrogatory.
13. Please state the last-known date that A.K., a Minor Child, engaged in visitation with Mother,
pursuant to the original Divorce Decree. Please provide explanations for specific instances where
Mother was denied visitation, if there are such instances.
Response: The last known date that AK had court ordered visitation with her mother
was on May 12, 2024, for Mother’s Day. I met Brittany at the ACPD to do
custody exchange and Lt. Sheronda Cross forced AK out of my care into
Brittany’s car. I have never refused to allow AK to visit with her mother.
This response was submitted July 30, 2024. There is sufficient reason to believe that this response
is not up to date. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory
with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature.
Requests for Production:
1. Please provide documents or communications demonstrating the reasons for any denial of
visitation rights to Brittany Gilliland since February 27, 2024.
Response: None.
Your client has communicated extensively regarding our client’s visitation and the denial of such.
Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory with an accurate
and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature. This includes any
correspondence between the parties, or between your client and another party.
2. Please provide all correspondence, emails, texts, and written notes between you and the children’s
school or educational institutions regarding Brittany Gilliland.
Response: See attached
This response was submitted July 30, 2024. There is sufficient reason to believe that this response
is not up to date. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement this interrogatory
with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in nature.
3. Please provide any recordings, videos, or other electronic evidence that demonstrates interactions
between you and the minor children wherein Brittany Gilliland was discussed.
Response: None
Your client has recorded and documented several interactions between himself and the Minor
Children in relation to our client. Due to the outdated nature of this response, please supplement
this interrogatory with an accurate and current response as discovery is ongoing and continuing in
nature. This includes any correspondence between the parties, the minor children, or other parties
whom your client has discussed these interactions with.
5. Produce copies of all photos, videos, CDs or other evidence you have in this case, even if you do
not plan on using it at trial or any other proceeding of this action. This includes any rebuttal and/or
impeachment evidence.
Response: Objection. Rebuttal/impeachment witnesses cannot be determined at this
time.
Your client must produce copies of all photos, videos, CDs or other evidence you have in this case,
even if you do not plan on using it at trial or any other proceeding of this action. This includes any
rebuttal and/or impeachment evidence. This response is not acceptable as it is presented and is
therefore, deficient. Please supplement this interrogatory.
7. Please provide any and all bank statements, passbooks, certificates of deposit, or other written
memoranda of any kind and description reflecting ownership by you in whole or in part, legal or
equitable, of any savings account or bank account or account in any financial institution, including,
but not limited to, savings and loan associations, credit unions, banks or accounts maintained with
any brokerage firm from the last three years.
Response: Objection. Irrelevant as to issues in Petition.
Your client objects to this request for production due to a lack of relevance to our client’s Petition.
Both Parties have stated on multiple occasion that finances are a paramount issue in this contempt
action. Your client is currently in a bankruptcy action that directly impacts Petitioner. Furthermore,
due to a change in circumstances, child support is due to be recalculated. This response is deficient.
Please provide a sufficient answer to this request.
Please supplement all deficient requests no later than September 11, 2025. Should you
have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at 334.759.7557, or by email at
barbara@agricolalaw.com. Thank you.
Very truly yours,
Barbara H. Agricola
BAP/ab
